thread.title: FIRST ALERT WEATHER - Breezy at times, but a nice finish to our weekend!
thread.title_full: FIRST ALERT WEATHER - Breezy at times, but a nice finish to our weekend!

author: @wis10
title: FIRST ALERT WEATHER - Breezy at times, but a nice finish to our weekend!
text: FIRST ALERT WEATHER - Breezy at times, but a nice finish to our weekend! COLUMBIA, S.C. (WIS) – We’re still breezy at times throughout the day, but extended sunshine will help us warm up this afternoon. First Alert Headlines - A nice end to the weekend! - Showers for some of us Tuesday morning. - Much colder air settles into the Midlands next week. First Alert Summary After a breezy and cool start to the weekend, our forecast gets better today! The breeze from yesterday has weakened, but you’ll still notice it at times during the afternoon. Gusts of 20 to 25 MPH are possible. It’ll be warmer thanks to all the sunshine we receive, with high temperatures topping out in the upper-50s. A weak disturbance will move through the Carolinas Monday night and Tuesday. With it, a few showers are possible, but not all of us will pick up rain. These will start around sunrise, continuing across the Midlands through lunchtime. By the afternoon, we’ll dry out across the region. This disturbance helps to reinforce some of our colder temperatures! On Wednesday, even though we’ll have a sky full of sunshine, highs will only hit the mid-40s. We’ll get back to the very cold mornings on Thursday. Lows to start the day will be hanging around 20 degrees! First Alert Forecast Today: Lots of sunshine. Breezy at times, with highs in the upper-50s. Tonight: Increasing clouds, becoming mostly cloudy by sunrise. Lows fall into the mid-30s. MLK Day: Mostly cloudy skies. Highs near 60 degrees. Tuesday: A few showers around through lunchtime. Chance of rain 30%. Highs in the mid-50s. Wednesday: Plenty of sunshine. Cooler, with highs in the mid-40s. Thursday: Partly cloudy skies. Highs in the mid-50s. Notice a spelling or grammar error in this article? [Click or tap here](mailto:wis-webproducers@gray.tv) to report it. Please include the article's headline.
